<a id="NoiseTexture2D"></a>

# NoiseTexture2D

**Inherits:** [Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **\<** [Texture](Texture.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A 2D texture filled with noise generated by a [Noise](Noise.md) object.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Uses the [FastNoiseLite](FastNoiseLite.md) library or other noise generators to fill the texture data of your desired size. **NoiseTexture2D** can also generate normal map textures.

The class uses [Thread](Thread.md)\\ s to generate the texture data internally, so [Texture2D.get_image()](Texture2D.md#Texture2D_method_get_image) may return ``null`` if the generation process has not completed yet. In that case, you need to wait for the texture to be generated before accessing the image and the generated byte data:

```
    var texture = NoiseTexture2D.new()
    texture.noise = FastNoiseLite.new()
    await texture.changed
    var image = texture.get_image()
    var data = image.get_data()
```


<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_as_normal_map"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **as_normal_map** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_as_normal_map)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_as_normal_map**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_normal_map**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the resulting texture contains a normal map created from the original noise interpreted as a bump map.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_bump_strength"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **bump_strength** = `8.0` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_bump_strength)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_bump_strength**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_bump_strength**\ (\ )

Strength of the bump maps used in this texture. A higher value will make the bump maps appear larger while a lower value will make them appear softer.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_color_ramp"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Gradient](Gradient.md) **color_ramp** [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_color_ramp)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_color_ramp**\ (\ value\: [Gradient](Gradient.md)\ )
- [Gradient](Gradient.md) **get_color_ramp**\ (\ )

A [Gradient](Gradient.md) which is used to map the luminance of each pixel to a color value.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_generate_mipmaps"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **generate_mipmaps** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_generate_mipmaps)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_generate_mipmaps**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_generating_mipmaps**\ (\ )

Determines whether mipmaps are generated for this texture. Enabling this results in less texture aliasing in the distance, at the cost of increasing memory usage by roughly 33% and making the noise texture generation take longer.

\ **Note:** [generate_mipmaps](NoiseTexture2D.md#NoiseTexture2D_property_generate_mipmaps) requires mipmap filtering to be enabled on the material using the **NoiseTexture2D** to have an effect.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_height"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **height** = `512` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_height)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_height**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_height**\ (\ )

Height of the generated texture (in pixels).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_in_3d_space"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **in_3d_space** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_in_3d_space)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_in_3d_space**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_in_3d_space**\ (\ )

Determines whether the noise image is calculated in 3D space. May result in reduced contrast.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_invert"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **invert** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_invert)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_invert**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_invert**\ (\ )

If ``true``, inverts the noise texture. White becomes black, black becomes white.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_noise"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Noise](Noise.md) **noise** [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_noise)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_noise**\ (\ value\: [Noise](Noise.md)\ )
- [Noise](Noise.md) **get_noise**\ (\ )

The instance of the [Noise](Noise.md) object.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_normalize"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **normalize** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_normalize)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_normalize**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_normalized**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the noise image coming from the noise generator is normalized to the range ``0.0`` to ``1.0``.

Turning normalization off can affect the contrast and allows you to generate non repeating tileable noise textures.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_seamless"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **seamless** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_seamless)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_seamless**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_seamless**\ (\ )

If ``true``, a seamless texture is requested from the [Noise](Noise.md) resource.

\ **Note:** Seamless noise textures may take longer to generate and/or can have a lower contrast compared to non-seamless noise depending on the used [Noise](Noise.md) resource. This is because some implementations use higher dimensions for generating seamless noise.

\ **Note:** The default [FastNoiseLite](FastNoiseLite.md) implementation uses the fallback path for seamless generation. If using a [width](NoiseTexture2D.md#NoiseTexture2D_property_width) or [height](NoiseTexture2D.md#NoiseTexture2D_property_height) lower than the default, you may need to increase [seamless_blend_skirt](NoiseTexture2D.md#NoiseTexture2D_property_seamless_blend_skirt) to make seamless blending more effective.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_seamless_blend_skirt"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **seamless_blend_skirt** = `0.1` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_seamless_blend_skirt)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_seamless_blend_skirt**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_seamless_blend_skirt**\ (\ )

Used for the default/fallback implementation of the seamless texture generation. It determines the distance over which the seams are blended. High values may result in less details and contrast. See [Noise](Noise.md) for further details.

\ **Note:** If using a [width](NoiseTexture2D.md#NoiseTexture2D_property_width) or [height](NoiseTexture2D.md#NoiseTexture2D_property_height) lower than the default, you may need to increase [seamless_blend_skirt](NoiseTexture2D.md#NoiseTexture2D_property_seamless_blend_skirt) to make seamless blending more effective.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture2D_property_width"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **width** = `512` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture2D_property_width)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_width**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_width**\ (\ )

Width of the generated texture (in pixels).
